title: Conic Equations and Parameterizations - Part A

content.description:
The x axis ranges from negative 8 to 10 in increments of 1. 

The y axis ranges from negative 12 to 1 in increments of 1. 

The ellipse intersects its horizontal line of symmetry at (negative 7 comma negative 7) and (9 comma negative 7). 

The ellipse intersects its vertical line of symmetry at (1 comma negative 3) and (1 comma negative 11).

Graph of ellipse <math> <semantics> <mn>1</mn> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaaaaa@39B7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

Equation for ellipse <math> <semantics> <mn>2</mn> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaaaaa@39B7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>
 <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>36</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4334@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

Equation for hyperbola
 <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mn>9</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A40@</annotation> </semantics> </math>
content.question:
Part A

The graph of ellipse <math> <semantics> <mn>1</mn> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaaaaa@39B7@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is given. An equation for ellipse <math> <semantics> <mn>1</mn> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaaaaa@39B7@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaamyEaaaa@3AF7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>-plane can be represented as <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>h</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>a</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>b</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B72@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find the values of <math> <semantics> <mi>a</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGHbaaaa@39E2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mi>b</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGHbaaaa@39E2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGHbaaaa@39E2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and <math> <semantics> <mi>k</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGHbaaaa@39E2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text:
Part A

The graph of ellipse <math> <semantics> <mn>1</mn> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaaaaa@39B7@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is given. An equation for ellipse <math> <semantics> <mn>1</mn> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaaaaa@39B7@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaamyEaaaa@3AF7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>-plane can be represented as <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>h</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>a</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>b</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B72@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find the values of <math> <semantics> <mi>a</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGHbaaaa@39E2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mi>b</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGHbaaaa@39E2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGHbaaaa@39E2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and <math> <semantics> <mi>k</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGHbaaaa@39E2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
